levels.text: The first key I pressed echoed louder than it should have — like it had been waiting 101 years.
The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear 001, and it still lingers between each keystroke.
Each tap of the spacebar sounded like a heartbeat — 7… 8… 9 — faster every time I typed.
No live organism can continue at 120 WPM under conditions of absolute fear.
My code compiled perfectly, but line 666 kept rewriting itself in red.
The walls whispered in binary: 01001000 01000101 01001100 01010000.
The cursor blinked 13 times before the screen asked, ‘Are you alone?’
I hit ESC repeatedly, but the system replied '404.666 — soul not found.'
I pressed F1 for help, but the whispers said 'function unavailable.'
Every word I typed appeared twice — once on screen, once in the mirror.
I held Control, but something else was holding me.
> run type_till_dawn.exe — 0%… 13%… 66%… 100%… then silence.
The keyboard typed 'hello' on its own at 3:33 AM.
Between Q and W a new key appeared — its label read '13'.
I heard all things in the heaven and in the earth — and many things in hell.
I tried to fix the error, but each Ctrl + Z only brought it closer.
The monitor displayed 'task complete' but the CPU temp rose to 666 °C.
Thirteen keys pressed themselves down without a sound.
Parentheses closed themselves and the semicolon bled across the screen.
System rebooting… WPM: 999 | Status: Possessed.
